title: UGA officially announces Tray Scott hiring
text:
UGA officially announces Tray Scott hiring Georgia has officially announced the hiring of Tray Scott as defensive line coach.   
The University of Georgia released a statement late Friday evening that Tray Scott has been hired as the defensive line coach for the Bulldogs, confirming an earlier report by CoachingScoop.com. 
Scott held the same position at North Carolina in 2015 and 2016 before being hired away by Ole Miss in December. He now makes the move to UGA before coaching in a game as the Rebels' defensive line coach. Before his time at North Carolina, Scott was the defensive line coach at the University of Tennessee at Martin and held a graduate assistant post at Ole Miss. (Photo: Ross Martin, 247Sports)   
A graduate of Arkansas Tech in 2008, Scott's star is trending upward in the coaching ranks according to second-year head coach Kirby Smart . 
“Tray is considered one of the very best up and coming defensive line coaches in the country,” said Smart. “He’s going to be an immediate asset as we begin planning for spring practice. Tray will complement our current coaching staff and will be excellent in the development of our defensive linemen.” 
Dawgs247 has also obtained the salary details in Scott's contract. The UGA assistant will earn $325,000 in 2017, which is $200,000 less than Tracy Rocker was set to make for the coming season. According to Jason Butt of the Macon Telegraph, Scott will make $50,000 less than he was going to earn at Ole Miss for the 2017 season.
